Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley struck out Austin Wells with a series of slowing sliders to end the game in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Gibson, the winning pitcher, presented an authenticated ball from the game to his father.
Manager Oliver Marmol joked that he pulled Kyle too soon, implying Gibson pitched fewer innings than in the 1964 game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals won their first game at the new Yankee Stadium since 2009 and their first over the Yankees in the Bronx since 1964.
The game featured a dramatic ninth inning with a double by Juan Soto and a near-walk-off home run by Giancarlo Stanton.
